result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Azair Castaneda

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Azair Castaneda in court.  Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti appeared by video for Azair Castaneda.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  Defendant did not qualify for TAD evaluation. Defense requests further status conference be set to allow additional time for counsel to discuss case with the Defendant. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense request to reschedule Status Conference set for 10/18/2022 at 8:30 am.  Matter rescheduled to 10/28/2022 at 9 am in person.
Defense Amended Motion to Adjourn, filed.

Defendant Azair Castaneda appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti appeared by video for Azair Castaneda.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Jon Josephsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defendant to undergo a TAD evaluation. Defense requests adjourned Status conference date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Azair Castaneda in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Arraignment hearing.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Defense has received discovery from the State and requests additional time to review same. Court sets this matter for Scheduling Conference.

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Azair Castaneda in court with Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Rutherford. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Azair Castaneda in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 8/01/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 059358,
Payable Number: 1015974,
Receipt Number: 22RP025952,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-27-2022 @1:30p
